importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the road crash in Uganda, which led to over 40 deaths and triggered national responses from government and emergency services.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The exact time of the crash on the Kampala-Gulu Highway, which helps establish the sequence of events and contextualizes the timing of emergency responses and official statements.

keyTakeAways: Forty-six people were killed in a head-on and side collision on the Kampala-Gulu Highway, after two buses attempting to overtake a lorry and car met head-on.
The initial death toll of 63 was revised down by police, who excluded individuals who were unconscious and now being treated, highlighting challenges in initial casualty reporting.
The crash was attributed to dangerous overtaking behavior, which police identified as a leading cause of crashes in Uganda.
A chain reaction occurred when one bus swerved to avoid impact, leading to multiple vehicles losing control and overturning.

President Yoweri Museveni expressed sorrow over the crash, offered condolences, and directed financial compensation: five million shillings ($1,430) per bereaved family and one million shillings to injured individuals.
The injured were transported to hospitals in Kiryandongo, a western town in Uganda.
An official investigation has been launched to determine the root cause of the accident.
Police have urged motorists to avoid dangerous overtaking, emphasizing it as a key risk factor in road safety across the country.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A major road crash on the Kampala-Gulu Highway in Uganda resulted in 46 fatalities after two buses attempting to overtake a lorry and car collided head-on, triggering a chain reaction. The initial death toll of 63 was revised downward, with police noting the inclusion of unconscious victims. The crash, attributed to dangerous overtaking—a leading cause of accidents in Uganda—led to significant injuries, with victims transported to hospitals in Kiryandongo. President Yoweri Museveni condemned the tragedy, expressed condolences, and ordered financial compensation for families and injured individuals. Police launched an investigation and urged all motorists to avoid reckless overtaking to prevent future accidents.
title: Uganda road crash leaves more than 40 dead
